Class DifficultySelection

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • DifficultySelection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DifficultySelection
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The DifficultySelection class is a menu that allows the user to choose the difficulty level of their game.
    Version:
    Version 1.0 June 1st, 2012
    Author:
    Peng Chen, Branson Lee
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Method that must be implemented. It will be involked automatically once the user clicks on a button.

        Depending on which level the user selected, the score increment will be different. Either way, any choice will lead to the Game class.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - The ActionEvent that has all the information regarding on what the user clicked.
